719140f-a.title: Manhattan: Columbus Circle - 8th Avenue (Southwest).
719140f-a.text:
Columbus Circle (West 59th Street) at the
S.W. corner of Eighth Avenue (left).
Across the roofs of these low structures
appears a portion of the building at the N.W.
corner of 58th Street housing ''Reisenweber's,a
famous rendezvous.
About 1900
Gift of Urbrock Collection
MAY BE REERODICCED

719131f-a.title: Manhattan: Columbus Circle - 8th Avenue - Broadway.
719131f-a.text:
Columbus Circle, west side, north from but not including Eighth
Ave, to and including Broadway. Also shown is West 59th Street, north
side, west from and including Columbus Circle.
About 1918.
William Henry.

719130f-a.title: Manhattan: Columbus Circle - Broadway - 8th Avenue.
719130f-a.text:
Columbus Circle, south side, west from and including Broadway, to,
but not including Eighth Ave. The view also shows Broadway, east side,
Mnorth from but not including West 55th to West 59th Streets, and
a1so Eighth Ave, east side, north from but not including West 56th
Street, to and including Columbus Circle.
About 1924.
Ewing Galloway.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

731230f-a.title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - Macy's Thanksgiving Parade, No. 1-3.
731230f-a.text:
(1)
Macy's Thanksgiving Parade, 1932, No. 1. At Columbus Circle:
An alligator balloon, one of those which are regularly de-
aigned by Tony Sarg is hovering over the crowd and leering
hnungrily at some of the spectators. The camera points north
on Broadway from Columbus Circle.
November 24, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
No. 2. Another view; the camera is facing north on Central
Park West.
November 24, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
No. 3. Another view of the alligator.
November 24, 1932.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
731230f-a.folder: Broadway and Columbus Circle and Central Park West, Manhattan, N.Y.

731238f-a.title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - Macy's Thanksgiving Parade.
731238f-a.text:
(1)
Macy's Thanksgiving Parade, 1933, No. 1. A balloon representing
a chicken, held down close to the street, at Columbus Circle.
The view is south on Eighth Avenue.
November 30, 1933.
P.  L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
No. 2. The dachshund of this year, with Macy's red star on
his left side. Columbus Circle; the view is south at Eighth
Avenue.
November 30, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
No. S. A fat man in a bathing suit. The view is southwest.
November 30, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

713982f-a.text:
W. 58th Street, north side, w3st of No. 315 (right, the
first brownstone house) a point to the west of Eighth Avenue.
est of the Ninth Avenue Elevated lLine is Roosevelt Hospital.

719142f-b.title: Manhattan: Columbus Circle - Broadway - 8th Avenue.
719142f-b.text:
(1)
Columbus Circle, east side, west from and including Broadway to
and including Eighth Ave. This view also shows Eighth Ave, east side,
aouth from and including Columbus Circle, (West 59th Street,) to and
including West 58th Street.
September 19, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
Columbus Circle,w.59th Street,Broadway and Eighth Avenue,showing
where these avenues meet,at the south westtern corner of Central Park.
The statue of Columbus was erected by the Italians resident in
America,and presented on the I2th of October,I892,the fourth centenary
of the discovery of America.
Copy right I893.
J.S.Johnston and Co. Photographers,
Neu York City.
